Jsp.tag:
name = "listRowCheckBox" body-content = "empty" display-name = "listRowCheckBox" description = "Represents a list row check box. If you want, you can bind its state to the list row model object Boolean field value."

getOnclickScript

protected String getOnclickScript()
Creates the onclick event script, including the onclick script that the user specifies through attribute value.

Specified by:
getOnclickScript in class BaseListRowControlTag
Returns:
The entire script for check box onclick event.

getCheckBoxId

protected String getCheckBoxId()
                        throws javax.servlet.jsp.JspException
Creates the check box ID. Note that it is very important how the ID looks like. It means that the ID of the row check box must begin with the ID value of the select-all check box to make the JavaScript methods work.

Returns:
The ID that will be used for the generated check box.
Throws:
javax.servlet.jsp.JspException - This method requires listId and rowRequestId entries from the context.

isChecked

protected boolean isChecked()
                     throws javax.servlet.jsp.JspException
This method decides whether the check box should be checked or not. If the attribute checked is true then it will always render it checked. Otherwise, it also looks from viewData whether the row has been checked (by the user) before.

Returns:
A Boolean indicating whether the check box should be rendered checked.
Throws:
javax.servlet.jsp.JspException - This method expects to have access to ROW_KEY and list view model in the JSP context.

setValue

public void setValue(String value)
              throws javax.servlet.jsp.JspException
Throws:
javax.servlet.jsp.JspException
Jsp.attribute:
type = "java.lang.String" required = "false" description = "Allows a custom value for this check box (when it is submitted). Default value is selected."
